subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If You, O Lord, kept a record of sins, O Lord, who could stand? But with You there is forgiveness; therefore You are feared. (Psalms 130:3, 4)
reflection: What if, each day God kept track one by one of our filthy thoughts, biting words, and unkind actions? How often do we go through the day without realizing how often we have sinned? If we could see a bowl overflowing with our wrongs, we would have to say like the psalmist, "How can I stand before You, O Lord? I'm lost!" But the psalmist goes on with words we need to hear."With You There is forgiveness." ~ Yes God sent His own Son to empty the bowl of our sins. Thank God, He credits Jesus' payment to us instead of recording our sins against us.
prayer: Thank you, Lord, for wiping my record clean through Jesus' payment for all my sins. Amen.
original_content:
07/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT IF GOD COUNTED?

Our Bible Verses for Today:
If You, O Lord, kept a record of sins, O Lord, who could stand?
But with You there is forgiveness; therefore You are feared.
(Ps. 130:3, 4)

Our Lesson for Today:
What if, each day God kept track one by one of our filthy thoughts, biting words,
and unkind actions? How often do we go through the day without realizing how
often we have sinned?

If we could see a bowl overflowing with our wrongs, we would have to say like 
the psalmist, "How can I stand before You, O Lord? I'm lost!"

But the psalmist goes on with words we need to hear."With You There is 
forgiveness." ~ Yes God sent His own Son to empty the bowl of our sins.
Thank God, He credits Jesus' payment to us instead of recording our sins 
against us...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank you, Lord, for wiping my record clean through Jesus'
payment for all my sins...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [You] hurl all our iniquities into the depths of the sea. (Micah 7:19)
reflection: "They are all gone, " the psalmist tells me."God has hurled them into the depths of the sea." Jesus came to wrap all those sins into one gigantic ball, load it on the barge of His love, and dump it into the deepest part of the ocean. What a picture! God has paid for my sins with the blood of His Son. He's put them totally out of sight as if they never happened. Where do they go? Into the depths of the sea, where God no longer sees them and where He places the sign."No fishing allowed, ' that means I am to leave them alone too.
prayer: Dear Lord, remind me daily how you have totally removed my sins through Jesus' blood. Amen.
original_content:
07/03/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT HAPPENS TO OUR SINS?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
[You] hurl all our iniquities into the depths of the sea. (Micah 7:19)

Our Lesson for Today:
"They are all gone," the psalmist tells me."God has hurled them into the
depths of the sea."

Jesus came to wrap all those sins into one gigantic ball, load it on the barge
of His love, and dump it into the deepest part of the ocean. What a picture!

God has paid for my sins with the blood of His Son. He's put them totally out
of sight as if they never happened. Where do they go? Into the depths of the sea,
where God no longer sees them and where He places the sign."No fishing allowed,'
that means I am to leave them alone too...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, remind me daily how you have totally
removed my sins through Jesus' blood...Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If the Son sets you free you will be free indeed. (John 8:36)
reflection: Thousands gave their lives in four major conflicts in the 20th century alone so that Miss Liberty might stand tall in New York's harbor, and so we can breath free."The Cross of Calvary" it's called, those timbers set up on that skull-shaped hill. the wood's long ago, but not the liberty secured there. On that cross God's Son secured a freedom far more precious than any other in the world. That cross speaks of freedom from sin's curse and Satan's slavery. No more frantic scrambling to secure salvation with our own futile works. No more chilling fear of deaths cold chamber. The Son has set us free. This freedom also had a price. ~ Nearly 2, 000 years ago, the God-man hung on that cross enduring the worst that both earth and hell could dispense. But He secured liberty in full with His complete payment for all sinners of all time. Now He offers that precious liberty to me with out price. It's mine free of cost. I'm free to live for God and with God, on earth and in eternity.
prayer: Blessed Savior, help me appreciate the precious liberty You've earned for Me. Amen.
original_content:
07/04/2010~~~food for thought~~~FREEDOM IS NOT FREE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
If the Son sets you free you will be free indeed...(Jn. 8:36)

Our Lesson for Today:
Thousands gave their lives in four major conflicts in the 20th century alone
so that Miss Liberty might stand tall in New York's harbor, and so we can breath 
free...

"The Cross of Calvary" it's called, those timbers set up on that skull-shaped
hill. the wood's long ago, but not the liberty secured there. On that cross God's
Son secured a freedom far more precious than any other in the world. That
cross speaks of freedom from sin's curse and Satan's slavery...

No more frantic scrambling to secure salvation with our own futile works. No more
chilling fear of deaths cold chamber. The Son has set us free...

This freedom also had a price. ~ Nearly 2,000 years ago, the God-man hung on 
that cross enduring the worst that both earth and hell could dispense. But He 
secured liberty in full with His complete payment for all sinners of all time. Now
He offers that precious liberty to me with out price. It's mine free of cost. I'm
free to live for God and with God, on earth and in eternity.

Prayer Suggestion:
Blessed Savior, help me appreciate the precious 
liberty You've earned for Me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Restore to me the joy of Your Salvation. (Psalms 51:12)
reflection: Only one kind of person can live happily all the time. That's the believer in Christ. No, a Christian's life is not always filled with sunshine. He or she doesn't always walk on a super smooth highway. ~ In fact, often believers have more problems than unbelievers. ~ In His wisdom, God knows that all sunshine and no rain is not conductive for growing the flower of faith. So how can believers rejoice all the time? How can they smile in the midst of tears and be happy even when they hurt? ~ Doesn't the psalmist remind us? He points us to God's salvation. When I have complete relief from life's greatest hurting the form of forgiveness for my sins, I have joy that no outward circumstances can strip from me. When I have the Savior, as the pearl of great price, I am ecstatically rich even if my earthly treasures slip away. When I have heaven as my destination, I can keep on smiling even though the potholes of life jar my very existence.
prayer: Dear Lord, restore to me the joy of Your salvation so that each day I rejoice in Jesus. Amen.
original_content:
07/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~ALWAYS REJOICING?

Restore to me the joy of Your Salvation...(Ps. 51:12)

Our Lesson for Today:
Only one kind of person can live happily all the time. That's the believer in Christ.
No, a Christian's life is not always filled with sunshine. He or she doesn't always

than unbelievers. ~ In His wisdom, God knows that all sunshine and no rain is

of tears and be happy even when they hurt? ~ Doesn't the psalmist remind us?
He points us to God's salvation...

When I have complete relief from life's greatest hurting the form of forgiveness 
for my sins, I have joy that no outward circumstances can strip from me. When
I have the Savior, as the pearl of great price, I am ecstatically rich even if my
earthly treasures slip away...

When I have heaven as my destination, I can keep on smiling even though the
potholes of life jar my very existence...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, restore to me the joy of Your salvation
so that each day I rejoice in Jesus...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Listen to my voice each morning, Lord. Each morning I bring my requests to You and I wait expectantly. (Psalms 5:3))
reflection: The secret to a close relationship with God is to pray to Him earnestly each morning. In the morning, our minds are more free from problems, and then we can commit the whole day to God. Regular communication helps any friendship and is certainly necessary for a strong relationship with God. ~ We need to communicate with Him daily. Do you have a regular time to pray and read God's Word???
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to remember to communicate with You regularly. Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Sing to the Lord a new song, for He has done marvelous things; His right hand and His holy arm have worked salvation for Him. (Psalms 98:1)
reflection: Oh how often we forget that we are to have a childlike faith ~ a childlike heart. Sometimes I even forget what Jesus has done for me. And so I rub away at my sins as if I had to eliminate their spots. I worriedly peer ahead at heaven's door as if I had to pry it open with my own deeds. Instead of singing, I mope around. YES sometimes I need a reminder of the marvelous things my gracious God has already done for me ~ how His right hand and holy arm have worked salvation for me in His Son, Jesus. YES, a new song ~ that's what we need and that's what will come when we knee; beneath the cross of our Savior.
prayer: Dear Lord, teach me to sing with joy because of Your salvation. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Once you were not a people, but now you are the people of God; once you had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy. (I Peter 2:10)
reflection: So often we hear people who base their self-worth on their accomplishments. But our relationship with Christ is far more important then our jobs, successes, wealth or knowledge. We should never forget we have been chosen by God as His very own, and we have been called to represent Him to others. Remember that your value comes from being one of God's children, not from what you can achieve. You have worth because of what God does, not because of what you do. God's mercy in Christ Jesus has changed me from a nobody to a somebody, a person He has included in His beautiful label "My people."
prayer: Dear Lord, thank You for Your rich mercy in Christ Jesus that really made me something. Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I have redeemed you; I have summoned you by name; you are mine. (Isaiah 43:1)
reflection: The Lord has a distinctive brand on those who belong to him, just as the ranchers had on their cattle years ago. When God says, "I have redeemed you, "He's pointing to the cross of Jesus. I was a maverick who didn't belong to God. With sins' strands, Satan had me tied hand and foot. When the time for the eternal roundup came, the devil would want to lock me forever inside his corral of hell. But God in all His mercy stepped in. He sent His son to buy sinners back from Satan. Not with so many dollars per head, but with the precious blood of His only Son. This price was sufficient for all sinners of all times."You are mine, "The God of all grace says. That's why I can say with joy, "His brand is on me!"
prayer: Dear Lord, thank You for making me your own through faith in Jesus. Keep Your brand on me. Amen.
original_content:
07/09/2010~~~food for thought~~~HIS BRAND'S ON ME

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I have redeemed you; I have summoned you by name;
you are mine...(Isa. 43:1)

Our Lesson for Today:
The Lord has a distinctive brand on those who belong to him, just as the ranchers had 
on their cattle years ago. When God says, "I have redeemed you," He's pointing to the 
cross of Jesus. I was a maverick who didn't belong to God. With sins' strands, Satan 
had me tied hand and foot. When the time for the eternal roundup came, the devil would 
want to lock me forever inside his corral of hell...

But God in all His mercy stepped in. He sent His son to buy sinners back from Satan.
Not with so many dollars per head, but with the precious blood of His only Son. This
price was sufficient for all sinners of all times...

"You are mine," The God of all grace says. That's why I can say with joy, 
"His brand is on me!"

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for making me your own through faith
in Jesus. Keep Your brand on me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: All of us have strayed away like sheep. We have left God's paths to follow our own. Yet the Lord laid on Him the guilt and sins of us all. (Isaiah 53:6)
reflection: Isaiah speaks of Israel straying from God and compares them to wandering sheep. Yet God would send the Messiah to bring them back into the fold. Think about it ~ we have the hindsight to see and know the identity of the promised Messiah, who has come and died for our sins. ~ But if we know all that Jesus did and still reject Him, our sin is much greater than that of the ancient Israelites, who could not see what we have seen. Have you given your life to Jesus, the "Good Shepherd" (John 10:11-16) or are you still like a wandering sheep?
prayer: Dear Lord, thank you that I, a wandering sheep, can say, "The Savior died for me." Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Praise the Lord, . who forgives all your sins and heals all your diseases. (Psalms 103:3)
reflection: There is no greater spiritual illness than sin. But many do not know they have it. The Pharisee thanked God that he wasn't like other people ~ robbers, evildoers, adulterers (Luke 18:11). But he was mortally sick with sinful pride and didn't even recognize the symptoms. The rich young ruler thought he was good enough to merit heaven but couldn't think of parting with his possessions (Luke 18:18). You could say he had influenza brought on by the sin of loving goods more than God. And my disease? Do I know how sick I am? How terminally ill with the sickness of sin? Unless I do, I'll feel little need for the healing a gracious God provides in Jesus. Our caring Physician, our gracious Lord, wrote out and filled the prescription for healing at no cost to us. He sent His Son for sinners like me. He is the medicine my dying soul must have.
prayer: Dear Lord, remind me every day of my sins so that I reach for the healing of Your forgiveness. Amen.
original_content:

Our caring Physician, our gracious Lord, wrote out and filled the prescription for

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You who have no money, come, buy and eat! Come, buy wine and milk without money and without cost. (Isaiah 55:1)
reflection: We are all aware of the fact that food costs are going up today. Yes food costs money, and only lasts for a short time, and it only meets our physical needs. But God offers us free nourishment that feeds our soul. How are we to get it? We are to come (55:1), listen (55:2), seek and call on God (55:6). YES, God salvation is freely offered, but to nourish our souls we must eagerly receive it. we will starve spiritually without this food as surely as we will starve physically without our daily bread.
prayer: Dear Lord, feed me with the free forgiveness bought by Jesus' blood and offered in Your Word. Amen.
original_content:
07/12/2010~~~food for thought~~~NOT ONE CENT

Our Bible Verse for Today:
You who have no money, come, buy and eat! Come, buy wine
and milk without money and without cost...(Isa. 55:1)

Our Lesson for Today:
We are all aware of the fact that food costs are going up today.
Yes food costs money, and only lasts for a short time, and it only
meets our physical needs...

But God offers us free nourishment that feeds our soul. How are we to get it?
We are to come (55:1), listen (55:2), seek and call on God (55:6)...

YES, God salvation is freely offered, but to nourish our souls we must
eagerly receive it. we will starve spiritually without this food as surely
as we will starve physically without our daily bread...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, feed me with the free forgiveness bought
by Jesus' blood and offered in Your Word...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I have hidden Your Word in my heart, that I might not sin against You. Psalms 119:11
reflection: During the summer months I have trouble finding enough repellent to keep the Minnesota mosquitoes at bay. Every time I leave the house without a liberal amount of mosquitoes spray all I get done is swatting them. This reminds me of beginning the day without a liberal amount of God's Word. It is the only thing that will help us keep the sins of the world at bay. When I spray a liberal amount of God's Word on my soul, sin can't bite quite as much. I do however, need to apply God's Word regularly if I want protection. That's why the psalmist wrote, "I have hidden Your Word in my heart that I might not sin against you."
prayer: Dear Lord, cover me with Jesus' pardon when sin bites and with His power when sin buzzes near. Amen.
original_content:
07/13/2010~~~food for thought~~~REPELLENT FOR SIN

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I have hidden Your Word in my heart, that I might not sin against You.
Ps. 119:11

Our Lesson for Today:
During the summer months I have trouble finding enough repellent to keep the
Minnesota mosquitoes at bay. Every time I leave the house without a liberal amount
of mosquitoes spray all I get done is swatting them...

This reminds me of beginning the day without a liberal amount of God's Word. 
It is the only thing that will help us keep the sins of the world at bay. When I spray
a liberal amount of God's Word on my soul, sin can't bite quite as much. I do however,
need to apply God's Word regularly if I want protection. That's why the psalmist wrote,
"I have hidden Your Word in my heart that I might not sin against you."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, cover me with Jesus' pardon when sin bites
and with His power when sin buzzes near...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now we know that if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed, we have a building from God, an eternal house in heaven, not built by human hands. (2 Corinthians 5:1)
reflection: Here we see that Paul compares our existence in the world to tenting. The world in which we live will not be here forever, nor will the bodies in which we walk through it. I believe that far to many people value their earthly existence as permanent. They build for themselves structures as if they were going to be here forever. AND when the time comes as it always does, for the tent stakes of this life to be pulled up, they become frantic. What the thought to be permanent was only temporary. And so they have no home to go to but hell. Waiting for me is an eternal house in heaven. ~ God Himself has built it, and that truth makes it certain. So does the material He used in building it. The blood of His beloved Son, His perfect payment for all my sins, and His complete keeping of all God's commandments are the concrete and lumber for my eternal home. That house will stand forever.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me remain focused on Your permanent heaven and help me to remain faithful on my way home. Amen.
original_content:

Now we know that if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed, we have a building

I believe that far to many people value their earthly existence as permanent. They
build for themselves structures as if they were going to be here forever. AND

And so they have no home to go to but hell...

Waiting for me is an eternal house in heaven. ~ God Himself has built it, and that truth
makes it certain. So does the material He used in building it. The blood of His beloved Son,

are the concrete and lumber for my eternal home. That house will stand forever.

Dear Lord, help me remain focused on Your permanent heaven
and help me to remain faithful on my way home...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For I am not ashamed of this Good News about Christ. It is the power of God at work, saving everyone who believes ~ Jew first and also Gentiles. (Romans 1:16)
reflection: Not only does the gospel tell me the good news, it is also God's power to bring me to faith. The gospel is both God's message and God's means. Our gracious God use it like some stick of dynamite to blast open my stony heart of unbelief, to convert that heart into a home for my Savior, and keep my heart in faith in His Son as my only Savior. The Gospel is far more powerful then dynamite. The Lord gave me a sinner, something far more powerful in His gospel.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me treasure and use the power of Your gospel as Your message and means. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ. (Galatians 6:14)
reflection: Have you ever noticed how often the Bible connects God's love with the cross? John 3:16 speaks of a God who so loved that He gave His one and only Son, a giving that led to the cross. Another well-known 3:16 says it too, "This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down His life for us" (I John). What kind of love is this? A love that seeks to repay family or gain favor from friends I can understand. BUT a love that gives the ultimate for enemies, a love that repays hatred and hostility with pardon and peace, how can we describe it? What can we do but marvel at it? Christ's cross = God's love = my salvation. So simple and so awesome! And so worthy of our praise.
prayer: Dear Lord, keep Your cross my trust and joy till in heaven I can praise You fully for Your Lore. Amen.
original_content:
07/16/2010~~~food for thought~~~CHRIST'S CROSS = GOD'S LOVE =
MY SALVATION

Our Bible verse for Today:
May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ.
(Gal. 6:14)

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you ever noticed how often the Bible connects God's love with the cross?
John 3:16 speaks of a God who so loved that He gave His one and only Son, a
giving that led to the cross...

Another well-known 3:16 says it too, "This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ
laid down His life for us" (I John).

What kind of love is this? A love that seeks to repay family or gain favor from friends I 
can understand. BUT a love that gives the ultimate for enemies, a love that repays hatred
and hostility with pardon and peace, how can we describe it? What can we do but marvel 
at it?

Christ's cross = God's love = my salvation. So simple and so awesome!
And so worthy of our praise...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, keep Your cross my trust and joy till in heaven
I can praise You fully for Your Lore...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I tell you ~ now is the time of God's favor ~ now is the day of salvation. (II Corinthians 6:2)
reflection: O how patient God is!!! ~ He wants me to look forward to heaven's shores where I can see Jesus. Every day that I open my eyes is a time of His favor ~ His grace ~ another day He grants me so that I might seek His salvation. ~ But God's patients has a limit. ~ How many more days does He have for me? How much more time for me to learn of my Savior? ~ We need to remember that He who gives life also measures life. ~ When He says that ~ it's time, He means ~ my life will end and with it my opportunity to seek His salvation. ~ If we dilly, dally along, we will have to face eternity without the Savior Jesus and with no one to blame but ourselves.
prayer: Dear Lord, don't leave me to myself or else I will only waste the opportunity You have given me. Open my heart to the news of Your Savior. Give me the hand of faith to hold Him as my treasure. Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness. (I John 1:9)
reflection: That's the number one question, isn't it? ~~~ What to do with my sin? If God has forgiven us for our sins because of Christ's death, why must we confess our sins? ~~~ In admitting our sins and receiving Christ's cleansing, we are (1) agreeing with God that our sin is truly sin and that we are willing to turn from it, (2) ensuring that we don't conceal our sins from Him and consequently from ourselves, and (3) recognizing our tendency to sin and relying on His power to overcome it. But we need to remember that true confession involves a commitment not to continue in sin. We wouldn't be genuinely confessing our sins to God IF we planned to commit them again and just wanted temporary forgiveness. ~ We should also pray for strength to defeat temptation the next time we face it.
prayer: Dear Lord, thank You for showing me Jesus as the answer for my sins. Give me the strength to defeat temptation. Amen.
original_content:
07/18/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT TO DO WITH SIN

Our Bible Verse for Today:
If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins
and purify us from all unrighteousness... (I Jn. 1:9)

Our Lesson for Today:
That's the number one question, isn't it? ~~~ What to do with my sin?

If God has forgiven us for our sins because of Christ's death, 
why must we confess our sins? ~~~

In admitting our sins and receiving Christ's cleansing, we are 
(1) agreeing with God that our sin is truly sin and that we are willing to turn from it,
(2) ensuring that we don't conceal our sins from Him and consequently from ourselves, and
(3) recognizing our tendency to sin and relying on His power to overcome it...

But we need to remember that true confession involves a commitment not to continue
in sin. We wouldn't be genuinely confessing our sins to God IF we planned to commit 
them again and just wanted temporary forgiveness. ~ We should also pray for strength
to defeat temptation the next time we face it...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for showing me Jesus as the answer for my sins.
Give me the strength to defeat temptation...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Your Word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path. (Psalms 119:105)
reflection: To walk in the woods at night we need a light so we don't trip over tree roots or stumble into some hole. In this life we are really walking through a dark forest of evil. But the Bible can be our light to show us a safe path so we won't stumble as we walk. It reveals to us the entangling roots of false values and philosophies. Let us remember to study the Bible so we will be able to see our way clear enough to stay on the right path.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to learn Your Word so that I have safe travel down the path of life. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (The parable of the lost son) While he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion for him; he ran to his son, threw his arms around him and kissed him. (Luke 15:20)
reflection: The parable of the prodigal son is really a story about the waiting father. I know who the prodigal son is. It is me who so foolishly and so often have left the Father's house. What I really need to know is about the heavenly Father. Does He write me out of His will or long for my return? Will He slam the door of heaven in my face or open His arms to me? Will He treat me as some slave or take me back as a son or daughter? Here's the answer!!! Because of another Son, named Jesus, who left His Father's house on the task of salvation and returned with it completed, my Father will be waiting for me.
prayer: Dear Father, thank you for still waiting for me although I often wander far from home. Amen.
original_content:
07/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE FATHER'S WAITING

Our Bible Verse for Today:
(The parable of the lost son) While he was still a long way off, his father saw 
him and was filled with compassion for him; he ran to his son, threw his arms
around him and kissed him. (Lk. 15:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
The parable of the prodigal son is really a story about the waiting father. I know who
the prodigal son is. It is me who so foolishly and so often have left the Father's house.

What I really need to know is about the heavenly Father. Does He write me out of His
will or long for my return? Will He slam the door of heaven in my face or open His arms 
to me? Will He treat me as some slave or take me back as a son or daughter?

Here's the answer!!! Because of another Son, named Jesus, who left His Father's 
house on the task of salvation and returned with it completed, my Father will be waiting 
for me...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Father, thank you for still waiting for me
although I often wander far from home...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more. (Jeremiah 31:34)
reflection: God sees and know my every sin. Even the ones I'm not aware of. Even the ones I try to hide from other people's eyes. Not a single one of my sins escapes Him. Every one of them earns His punishment that comes in the form of His displeasure on earth and eternal death in hell. So how come He says he remembers them no more? It can't be that they have slipped out of His mind or slowly fade from His remembrance. ~ No the answer is far more blessed than that. It's because He forgives my wickedness. In His love, God sent His beloved Son to take care of my sins. His Son took each one of my sins to the cross of pain and the suffering of hell to pay for them. Now the Father remembers them no more. His justice has been satisfied by His Son's payment. ~ His Son's holiness counts for me.
prayer: Dear Lord, turn me in humble repentance for my many sins to the cross of Your Son. Let me see His love removing my sins from Your remembrance. Amen.
original_content:

I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.
(Jer. 31:34)

Our Lesson for Today:
God sees and know my every sin. Even the ones I'm not aware of. Even the ones
I try to hide from other people's eyes. Not a single one of my sins escapes Him.
Every one of them earns His punishment that comes in the form of His displeasure
on earth and eternal death in hell...

So how come He says he remembers them no more? It can't be that they have slipped 
out of His mind or slowly fade from His remembrance. ~ No the answer is far more
blessed than that. It's because He forgives my wickedness. In His love, God sent
His beloved Son to take care of my sins...

His Son took each one of my sins to the cross of pain and the suffering of hell to pay
for them. Now the Father remembers them no more. His justice has been satisfied

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, turn me in humble repentance for my many sins 
to the cross of Your Son. Let me see His love removing my 
sins from Your remembrance...Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "What about you?" He [Jesus] asked."Who do you say I am?" Peter answered, "You are the Christ." ~ (Mark 8:29)
reflection: It's not that people don't know about Jesus. Rather, they don't really know who He is. just as when the Savior walked on earth, so many give wrong answers to His question, "Who do you say I am?" "Your my supply sergeant, " some answer."You're the one whom I ask when I need this or that in my life, " Unfortunately many popular preachers reinforce this error with their shallow teaching. Is that all Jesus means to you? Just some "genie in a bottle" who answers when you call? What about the Jesus who warns you not to gain the world and lose your soul? Who talks about taking up His cross and losing your life to save it? There are so many shallow answers given to this question, "Who do you say Jesus is?" WHY? Its because many have been listening to shallow preaching! And yes said to say but some still think even after hearing good preaching, "I don't need Him yet, I don't need a crouch yet. Really with this kind of thinking they just may find out how much they do really need Him but ~ when it's to late.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me answer with Peter, "You are the Christ." You are God Himself come into the flesh. Your blood paid for my sin and your resurrection guarantees heaven. You are my Savior." Amen.
original_content:
07/22/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT'S YOUR ANSWER?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"What about you?" He [Jesus] asked."Who do you say I am?" Peter answered,
"You are the Christ." ~ (Mk. 8:29) 

Our Lesson for Today:
It's not that people don't know about Jesus. Rather, they don't really know who He is.
just as when the Savior walked on earth, so many give wrong answers to His question,
"Who do you say I am?"

"Your my supply sergeant," some answer."You're the one whom I ask when I need 
this or that in my life," Unfortunately many popular preachers reinforce this error with
their shallow teaching...

Is that all Jesus means to you? Just some "genie in a bottle" who answers when you call?
What about the Jesus who warns you not to gain the world and lose your soul? Who talks
about taking up His cross and losing your life to save it?

There are so many shallow answers given to this question, "Who do you say Jesus is?"
WHY? Its because many have been listening to shallow preaching! And yes said to say
but some still think even after hearing good preaching, "I don't need Him yet, I don't need
a crouch yet...

Really with this kind of thinking they just may find out how much they do really need Him 
but ~ when it's to late...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me answer with Peter, "You are the Christ."
You are God Himself come into the flesh. Your blood paid
for my sin and your resurrection guarantees heaven. You are
my Savior..." Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And when she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, "Rejoice with me, I have found my lost coin." (Luke 15:9)
reflection: We have here a wonderful picture of how diligently Jesus searches for lost souls. His great love moves Him on the greatest treasure hunt this world has ever seen. ~ This hunt reached its height on Calvary's wondrous cross. Yes so precious did Jesus consider each sinner that He was willing to pay the maximum price for each one -- His own blood! Now His love sends Him out every day to search for lost sinners through His Word. How can I ever thank Jesus for the diligent love with which He ~ found me!!! When I sought Him not.
prayer: Thank You Lord Jesus, and please keep me safe in Your hand. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Please forgive me but I will be gone for a few days to Fargo to help
my daughter move to her new place...God bless, don't forget to visit
the Lord's house this week end...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For God so love the world that He gave His one and only Son, That whoever believes in Him shall not perish but have eternal life. (John 3:16)
reflection: Satan's most effective weapon is whispering in the sinner's ear, "You need to do something for your salvation." ~ "It's to easy, " Satan says when the sinner hears that all he has to do is believe in God's Son as his Savior. And sinners agree. ~ They want to produce the whole job of salvation. Salvation that requires no work whatsoever on their part just does not compute, it just not appeal to them. Of course Satan forgets to mention that the salvation that the sinner tries to acquire through his own works will only bring failure. The only thing a sinner needs to do is "Believe, " God said."Trust My one and only Son as your Savior. Look to His cross and see salvation complete. Look at His empty tomb and see sin forgiven. Throw yourself completely on Jesus' blood and righteousness and eternal life is yours." All we have to do is believe. And even our faith is a gift of God's grace.
prayer: Dear Lord, for the gift of faith in Jesus, I thank You. For its continuance, I trust You. Amen.
original_content:
Please forgive me but this will be the last Devotion until next week
as I will be busy in Moorhead moving my daughter's belongings to 
her new place...

07/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~ALL YOU HAVE TO DO

Our Bible Verse for Today:
For God so love the world that He gave His one and only Son,
That whoever believes in Him shall not perish but have eternal
life...(Jn. 3:16)

Our Lesson for Today:
Satan's most effective weapon is whispering in the sinner's ear,
"You need to do something for your salvation." ~ "It's to easy,"
Satan says when the sinner hears that all he has to do is believe
in God's Son as his Savior...

And sinners agree. ~ They want to produce the whole job of salvation.
Salvation that requires no work whatsoever on their part just does not 
compute, it just not appeal to them...

Of course Satan forgets to mention that the salvation that the sinner tries
to acquire through his own works will only bring failure...

The only thing a sinner needs to do is "Believe," God said."Trust My
one and only Son as your Savior. Look to His cross and see salvation 
complete. Look at His empty tomb and see sin forgiven. Throw yourself
completely on Jesus' blood and righteousness and eternal life is yours."

All we have to do is believe. And even our faith is a gift of God's grace...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, for the gift of faith in Jesus, I thank You.
For its continuance, I trust You...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We should be decent and pure in everything we do, so that everyone can approve  of your behavior. Don't participate in wild parties and getting drunk, or in adultery  and impure living, or in fighting and jealousy. ~ But let the Lord Jesus Christ take control of you, and don't think of ways to indulge your evil desires. (Romans 13:13-14)
reflection: I'm sure there are those who disagree with Paul when he lists fighting and jealousy with gross and obvious sins of drunkenness and immorality. ~ If you will notice in Paul's writings he considers attitudes as important as actions... Just as hatred leads to murder, so jealousy leads to strife and lust to adultery. When Christ returns, He wants to find His people clean on the inside as well as on the outside, In vs. 14 We are told to 'Let the Lord Jesus Christ take control of us.' How do we do this? (first) we identify with Christ by being baptized (Galatians 3:27). This shows our solidarity with other Christians and with the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. (second) We are to exemplify the qualities Jesus showed while He was here on earth  (love, humility, truth, service). In a sense we role-play what Jesus would do in our situation. (see Eph. 4:24-32; Colossians 3:10-17)...Yes we should avoid those situations that open the door to gratifying sinful desires. LIFE IS WHAT YOU MAKE IT.  It has always been ~ It will always be.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading and guiding, so that I might exemplify the qualities You lived while on earth. Amen.
original_content:
07/28/2010~~~food for thought~~~W~W~J~D

Our Bible Verses for Today: (These are verses which were sent to me by my cousin as homework)
We should be decent and pure in everything we do, so that everyone can approve 
of your behavior. Don't participate in wild parties and getting drunk, or in adultery 
and impure living, or in fighting and jealousy. ~ But let the Lord Jesus Christ take
control of you, and don't think of ways to indulge your evil desires...(Ro. 13:13-14)

Our Lesson for Today: (What I have gleaned from these verses)
I'm sure there are those who disagree with Paul when he lists fighting and jealousy with
gross and obvious sins of drunkenness and immorality. ~ If you will notice in Paul's 
writings he considers attitudes as important as actions...

Just as hatred leads to murder, so jealousy leads to strife and lust to adultery. When 
Christ returns, He wants to find His people clean on the inside as well as on the outside,

In vs. 14 We are told to 'Let the Lord Jesus Christ take control of us.' How do we do this?
(first) we identify with Christ by being baptized (Gal. 3:27). This shows our solidarity
with other Christians and with the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ.

(second) We are to exemplify the qualities Jesus showed while He was here on earth 
(love, humility, truth, service). In a sense we role-play what Jesus would do in our situation.
(see Eph. 4:24-32; Col. 3:10-17)...Yes we should avoid those situations that open the door 
to gratifying sinful desires.

LIFE IS WHAT YOU MAKE IT. 
It has always been ~ It will always be.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's
leading and guiding, so that I might exemplify the qualities
You lived while on earth...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not only ours but also for the sins of the whole world. (I John 2:2)
reflection: The cross of Jesus fits every sinner. The love He showed on the cross covers everyone. The suffering in the depths of hell paid for every sin. He died on that cross in the place of every sinner, from the first Adam in the garden to the last Adam when the world ends. When Jesus rose on the third day, He showed His payment for sin was sufficient to cover the whole world."The atoning sacrifice, " John described Him, a sacrifice that is sufficient to cover, "Not only for our sins but also for the sins of the whole world." There can be no doubt. Jesus' cross fits all. ~ it fits me. The Savior was tailor-made for me. ~~~ Jesus' cross assure me!
prayer: Dear Lord, help me each day to raise my eyes to Your cross. Remind me that Your sacrifice covers every sinner. Amen.
original_content:
07/29/2010~~~food for thought~~~ONE SIZE FITS ALL

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not only ours but also
for the sins of the whole world. (I Jn. 2:2)

Our Lesson for Today:
The cross of Jesus fits every sinner. The love He showed on the cross
covers everyone. The suffering in the depths of hell paid for every sin.
He died on that cross in the place of every sinner, from the first Adam
in the garden to the last Adam when the world ends...

When Jesus rose on the third day, He showed His payment for sin was
sufficient to cover the whole world."The atoning sacrifice," John described 
Him, a sacrifice that is sufficient to cover, "Not only for our sins but also 
for the sins of the whole world."

There can be no doubt. Jesus' cross fits all. ~ it fits me. The Savior was 
tailor-made for me. ~~~ Jesus' cross assure me!

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me each day to raise my eyes to Your cross. 
Remind me that Your sacrifice covers every sinner...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: She began to wet His feet with her tears. Jesus said to her, "Your sins are forgiven. Your faith has saved you, go in peace." (Luke 7:38, 48, 50)
reflection: Why was the woman in our verse crying? When we hurt people we love, sorrow and tears often come. That woman's life was riddled with sins. How many and what kind, we can only guess. At her Savior's feet she cried because she realized that every one of them was ultimately something done to Him [Jesus]. Repentance brought the tears with which she wet Jesus' feet. So did gratitude. She was crying not only because of what her sins had done to Jesus but also because of what Jesus had done to her sins. From Her Savior she heard it again."Your sins are forgiven, " He assured her. They're gone no matter what they are. Your faith has saved you, " He continued. It's My gift to you so that you can lay hold on Me."Go on peace, " He concluded ~ this is wonderful peace that only the forgiven sinner can appreciate. When we truly realize what our sins have done to Jesus and what Jesus has done to our sins, tears will come to our heart if not also to our eyes.
prayer: Dear Lord, tears are in order when I see how my sins have hurt You and how Your love has forgiven me. Amen.
original_content:
07/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHY DID SHE WEEP?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
She began to wet His feet with her tears... Jesus said to her,
"Your sins are forgiven...Your faith has saved you, go in peace."
(Lk. 7:38, 48, 50)

Our Lesson for Today:
Why was the woman in our verse crying? When we hurt people we love, 
sorrow and tears often come. That woman's life was riddled with sins.
How many and what kind, we can only guess...

At her Savior's feet she cried because she realized that every one of them 
was ultimately something done to Him [Jesus]. Repentance brought the tears
with which she wet Jesus' feet...

So did gratitude. She was crying not only because of what her sins had done 
to Jesus but also because of what Jesus had done to her sins. From Her 
Savior she heard it again."Your sins are forgiven," He assured her. They're
gone no matter what they are. Your faith has saved you," He continued. It's
My gift to you so that you can lay hold on Me."Go on peace," He concluded ~
this is wonderful peace that only the forgiven sinner can appreciate...

When we truly realize what our sins have done to Jesus and what Jesus has 
done to our sins, tears will come to our heart if not also to our eyes...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, tears are in order when I see how my sins have hurt You
and how Your love has forgiven me...Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I, the Son of Man, have come to seek and save those who are lost. (Luke 19:10)
reflection: There is one thing here that we may over look, that is, a reminder that a person is not saved because of a good heritage or condemned by a bad one. Faith is more important than genealogy. Jesus came to save all the lost no matter what their background or previous way of life. Through faith, the lost can be forgiven and made new.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You that I can say, "Jesus has lived and died for me." Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples. He departed from there to teach and preach in their cities. . (Matthew 11:1)
reflection: We need to watch so we do not began to debate with God and put what we call our duty into competition with His commands. if we say, "I know that He told me to go, but my duty is here, " it simply means that we do not believe that Jesus means what He says. Let us be careful not to play God's role in the lives of others, and become so noisy in our instruction of other people that God cannot get near them. There are times we need to keep our mouths shut and our spirits alert. God wants to instruct us regarding His Son, and He wants to turn our times of prayer into mounts of transfiguration. Are we detached enough from our own spiritual fits of emotion to wait patiently for Him? Waiting is not sitting with folded hands doing nothing, but learning to do what we are told.
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to be patient, yet sensitive to Your every command. Amen.
original_content:
08/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~LEARNING ABOUT HIS WAYS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
When Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples...
He departed from there to teach and preach in their cities..(Mt. 11:1)

Our Lesson for Today:
We need to watch so we do not began to debate with God and put what we
call our duty into competition with His commands. if we say, "I know that He
told me to go, but my duty is here," it simply means that we do not believe 
that Jesus means what He says...

Let us be careful not to play God's role in the lives of others, and become 
so noisy in our instruction of other people that God cannot get near them.
There are times we need to keep our mouths shut and our spirits alert...

God wants to instruct us regarding His Son, and He wants to turn our times 
of prayer into mounts of transfiguration. Are we detached enough from our
own spiritual fits of emotion to wait patiently for Him? Waiting is not sitting
with folded hands doing nothing, but learning to do what we are told...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to be patient, yet sensitive to Your every
command...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
